class.name: Phaser.Game

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of your game in game pixels. If given as a string the value must be between 0 and 100 and will be used as the percentage width of the parent container, or the browser window if no parent is given.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of your game in game pixels. If given as a string the value must be between 0 and 100 and will be used as the percentage height of the parent container, or the browser window if no parent is given.

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.help: Which renderer to use: Phaser.AUTO will auto-detect, Phaser.WEBGL, Phaser.CANVAS or Phaser.HEADLESS (no rendering at all).

parameters.name: parent
parameters.help: The DOM element into which this games canvas will be injected. Either a DOM ID (string) or the element itself.

parameters.name: state
parameters.help: The default state object. A object consisting of Phaser.State functions (preload, create, update, render) or null.

parameters.name: transparent
parameters.help: Use a transparent canvas background or not.

parameters.name: antialias
parameters.help: Draw all image textures anti-aliased or not. The default is for smooth textures, but disable if your game features pixel art.

parameters.name: physicsConfig
parameters.help: A physics configuration object to pass to the Physics world on creation.

class.help:
This is where the magic happens. The Game object is the heart of your game,
providing quick access to common functions and handling the boot process.
"Hell, there are no rules here - we're trying to accomplish something."
Thomas A. Edison

public.name: destroy
public.help: Nukes the entire game from orbit.

public.name: enableStep
public.help: Enable core game loop stepping. When enabled you must call game.step() directly (perhaps via a DOM button?)\nCalling step will advance the game loop by one frame. This is extremely useful for hard to track down errors!

public.name: step
public.help: When stepping is enabled you must call this function directly (perhaps via a DOM button?) to advance the game loop by one frame.\nThis is extremely useful to hard to track down errors! Use the internal stepCount property to monitor progress.

protected.name: boot
protected.help: Initialize engine sub modules and start the game.

protected.name: focusGain
protected.help: Called by the Stage visibility handler.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The DOM event that caused the game to pause, if any.

protected.name: focusLoss
protected.help: Called by the Stage visibility handler.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The DOM event that caused the game to pause, if any.

protected.name: gamePaused
protected.help: Called by the Stage visibility handler.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The DOM event that caused the game to pause, if any.

protected.name: gameResumed
protected.help: Called by the Stage visibility handler.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The DOM event that caused the game to pause, if any.

protected.name: setUpRenderer
protected.help: Checks if the device is capable of using the requested renderer and sets it up or an alternative if not.

protected.name: showDebugHeader
protected.help: Displays a Phaser version debug header in the console.

parameters.name: time
parameters.help: The current time as provided by RequestAnimationFrame.

public.name: antialias
public.inlineHelp: Anti-alias graphics. By default scaled images are smoothed in Canvas and WebGL, set anti-alias to false to disable this globally.

public.name: canvas
public.inlineHelp: A handy reference to renderer.view, the canvas that the game is being rendered in to.

public.name: context
public.inlineHelp: A handy reference to renderer.context (only set for CANVAS games, not WebGL)

public.name: debug
public.inlineHelp: A set of useful debug utilitie.

public.name: height
public.inlineHelp: The calculated game height in pixels.

public.name: isBooted
public.inlineHelp: Whether the game engine is booted, aka available.

public.name: onBlur
public.inlineHelp: This event is fired when the game no longer has focus (typically on page hide).

public.name: onFocus
public.inlineHelp: This event is fired when the game has focus (typically on page show).

public.name: onPause
public.inlineHelp: This event is fired when the game pauses.

public.name: onResume
public.inlineHelp: This event is fired when the game resumes from a paused state.

public.name: paused
public.help: The paused state of the Game. A paused game doesn't update any of its subsystems.\nWhen a game is paused the onPause event is dispatched. When it is resumed the onResume event is dispatched.
public.inlineHelp: Gets and sets the paused state of the Game.

public.name: pendingStep
public.inlineHelp: An internal property used by enableStep, but also useful to query from your own game objects.

public.name: preserveDrawingBuffer
public.inlineHelp: The value of the preserveDrawingBuffer flag affects whether or not the contents of the stencil buffer is retained after rendering.

public.name: raf
public.inlineHelp: Automatically handles the core game loop via requestAnimationFrame or setTimeout

public.name: renderType
public.inlineHelp: The Renderer this game will use. Either Phaser.AUTO, Phaser.CANVAS or Phaser.WEBGL.

public.name: rnd
public.inlineHelp: Instance of repeatable random data generator helper.

public.name: stepCount
public.inlineHelp: When stepping is enabled this contains the current step cycle.

public.name: stepping
public.inlineHelp: Enable core loop stepping with Game.enableStep().

public.name: time
public.inlineHelp: Reference to the core game clock.

public.name: transparent
public.inlineHelp: Use a transparent canvas background or not.

public.name: width
public.inlineHelp: The calculated game width in pixels.

private.name: _codePaused
private.inlineHelp: Was the game paused via code or a visibility change?
